snippet: Judge Richard Stearns’s work as a federal prosecutor could feed the perception of bias in the case against James (Whitey) Bulger, the court said.
abstract: Judge Richard G Stearns, assigned to preside over trial of crime boss James (Whitey) Bulger, is removed from case after federal appeals court finds that his career as federal prosecutor in Boston could feed perception of bias; removal of Stearns is rare legal move that marks significant victory for Bulger.
lead_paragraph: Judge Richard Stearns’s work as a federal prosecutor could feed the perception of bias in the case against James (Whitey) Bulger, the court said.

headline.seo: Judge Is Removed From Bulger Trial
headline.main: Court Removes Boston Judge From Trial of Crime Boss
headline.print_headline: Court Removes Boston Judge From Trial Of Crime Boss
